title: Cluster Flow: how a hierarchical clustering layer make allows deep-NNs more resilient to hacking, more human-like and easily implements relational reasoning. (arXiv:2304.14081v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: Despite the huge recent breakthroughs in neural networks (NNs) for artificial intelligence (specifically deep convolutional networks) such NNs do not achieve human-level performance: they can be hacked by images that would fool no human and lack `common sense'. It has been argued that a basis of human-level intelligence is mankind's ability to perform relational reasoning: the comparison of different objects, measuring similarity, grasping of relations between objects and the converse, figuring out the odd one out in a set of objects. Mankind can even do this with objects they have never seen before. translated_title: 聚类流（Cluster Flow）：如何通过层次聚类使深度神经网络更具鲁棒性、更符合人类思考方式、更易于实现关系推理
translated_abstract: 尽管神经网络（NNs）在人工智能领域（特别是深度卷积网络）取得了巨大的突破，但它们并没有达到人类水平的表现：它们可以被智能攻击，而人们无法被欺骗，也缺乏常识。已经有人认为，人类智能的基础是人类能够进行关系推理的能力：比较不同对象，测量相似性，掌握对象之间的关系。聚类流是一个半监督的层次聚类框架，可以通过利用预 SoftMax 层中发现的丰富的多维类别和特征数据，在经过训练的 NNs 上进行操作，构建类/特征的超空间地图，并将这些功能添加到现代深度卷积神经网络中，从而增加了更具人类思考方式的功能。作者通过3个任务来证明这一点。
tldr: 该论文介绍了一种半监督层次聚类框架ClusterFlow，可以在经过训练的深度卷积神经网络中使用密集的多维类别和特征数据来构建超空间地图，从而使其更具人类思考方式的功能，提高了其鲁棒性和实现关系推理的能力。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a semi-supervised hierarchical clustering framework, ClusterFlow, which can operate on trained deep convolutional neural networks and build a hyperspacial map of classes and features using dense multidimensional data, thereby enhancing their human-like functionality and improving their robustness and ability to perform relational reasoning.
